intro: Tibouchina kunhardtii, commonly known as the red-hot catwhiskers, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red bracts that surround small white flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its foliage is glossy and dark green, often with a slight aromatic scent. Tibouchina kunhardtii is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
